title: How to Check Your Green Dot Card Balance 6 Different Ways

steps.title: Register your Green Dot card online.
steps.content: Register your Green Dot card online. The easiest way to check your balance is to text Green Dot, however, the card needs to be registered. Go to Green Dot's activation page and enter your name, address, date of birth, social security number, 16-digit card number, expiration date, 3 digit security code, and mobile phone number. [1] X Research source You can also register through the Green Dot app by logging in and pressing Register / Activate Now.

steps.title: Text Green Dot at 42586.
steps.content: Text Green Dot at 42586. Text Green Dot (42586) the letters BAL followed by the last four digits of your card. Your text should look like “BAL 0000.” Green Dot will respond with your current balance. [2] X Research source If you’re having trouble, log into the Green Dot website, click on the link for “Mobile,” and manually register your cell phone number. To get transaction history, type the letters HIST followed by a space and the last 4 digits of your Green Dot Card number. Green Dot doesn’t charge for balance inquiries, but standard text messaging rates still apply.

steps.title: Log into Green Dot's website to access your account.
steps.content: Log into Green Dot's website to access your account. Click the “Log In” button on the right of Green Dot’s homepage . Enter your User ID and password, then click “Log In.” If you bought your Green Dot money card through a major retailer, you can also go to the retailer's website located on the card to check your balance. If you don't already have a User ID, click on the link labeled "Create One Now.” Enter your card information and personal details to create your account and view your balance.

steps.title: Check the balance which is visible on your account page.
steps.content: Check the balance which is visible on your account page. Once you log in, you will be automatically directed to a page displaying your Green Dot balance. You can also reload money onto your card from this website if your balance is low. [3] X Research source Be sure to look at all transactions, including pending purchases. Some purchases may not post to your card for a few days due to the way vendors process transactions. [4] X Research source If you set up direct deposit or have your government benefits go directly to your Green Dot card, there is no charge to reload.

steps.title: Call Green Dot customer support at 1-866-795-7597.
steps.content: Call Green Dot customer support at 1-866-795-7597. Green Dot customer support can be reached 7 days a week between 5 am and 9 pm PST. [5] X Research source The busiest time to call Green Dot is Friday, and the least busy is Sunday. You can get fast access to Green Dot Customer Care specialists by becoming a Green Dot VIP, which costs an additional $4.95 a month. VIPs don’t have to pay the $2.50 ATM fee, plus if you lose your card, you can get a replacement via Federal Express. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Choose the keypad option for balance inquiry.
steps.content: Choose the keypad option for balance inquiry. Enter your 16-digit card number and listen to the menu options. Press the number for balance inquiry.

steps.title: Enter your account and personal information when prompted.
steps.content: Enter your account and personal information when prompted. An automated voice will lead you through a series of steps, starting with entering the last four digits of your card. Continue following the prompts until given the option to check your balance. The telephone method is free of charge.

steps.title: Download the Green Dot mobile App.
steps.content: Download the Green Dot mobile App. Go to Green Dot’s website or an app store. Green Dot recommends using the app over other methods since it can give you the most up-to-date information. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Log into the app to check your balance.
steps.content: Log into the app to check your balance. Enter your login information or register your card . Once you log in, you can check your balance on the home screen.

steps.title: Use your card at a MoneyPass Network ATM.
steps.content: Use your card at a MoneyPass Network ATM. Insert your card into an ATM, enter your PIN, and press "Balance Inquiry." Use a MoneyPass Network ATM to check your balance for free. [8] X Research source If you didn’t set up a PIN when you received the card, call customer support at 1-866-795-7597. You can check your balance from a non-MoneyPass Network ATM for 50¢. [9] X Research source You can only use an ATM with a personalized card. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Sign up for balance alerts through your account.
steps.content: Sign up for balance alerts through your account. Log in to your Green Dot online account through the website or app. Click "Account alerts" on your account details screen and sign up for alerts through text or your email. [11] X Research source You can receive daily balance alerts, or you can sign up to be alerted when your balance drops below $25. [12] X Research source You can set up email alerts for up to two email addresses or receive a text message.
